revised_title: High Frequency Periodic Disturbances in Dissipative Systems: Small Amplitude, Finite Rate Theory
tldr: This article presents a detailed analysis of high-frequency periodic disturbances in dissipative systems, focusing on small amplitude, finite rate theory. The study involves a viscoelastic string as a model for the transmitting medium, and the results can be applied to various systems, including nonlinear transmission lines, nonlinear dielectric materials, and relaxing and reacting gas mixtures.
